question: I am a lawfully present immigrant who is not eligible yet to receive Medical Assistance. Is there a way I can enroll in Pennie during the Special Enrollment Period?
text:
I am a lawfully present immigrant who is not eligible yet to receive Medical Assistance. Is there a way I can enroll in Pennie during the Special Enrollment Period?
          
        
Yes! Pennie has added a new Qualifying Life Event (QLE) for those who have an annual income equal to or below the 150% Federal Poverty Level (FPL). Below is a table that shows the income amount.






Household / Family Size






Income 150% FPL










Single






$20,385










2-person






$27,465










3-person






$34,545










4-person






$41,625










6-person






$55,785










8-person






$69,945







For other family sizes, please 
to this link
.
If you are a lawfully present immigrant and are not able to enroll through Medical Assistance yet, you may qualify to enroll in coverage through Pennie and enroll under this qualifying life event. To do so, follow these steps below:


Go to pennie.com, click 
Get Covered, 
and submit a new Pennie application.


If you qualify, a Special Enrollment Period (SEP) will automatically open!


Once the SEP opens, you will have 60-days to enroll in a plan through Pennie. Once you enroll, coverage will begin the start of the following month.
